result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurtis D Cesar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with 4 days credit.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $8,100 payable to BMO Harris. FIRST PRIORITY. The Court further orders that all proceeds from the defendant's divorce should be paid through probation department to BMO Harris.
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA);
All applicable fees of supervision.
No cash bail posted in this matter.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with any area where drugs are packaged, consumed or sold.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Court stayed commencement until 4/4/2015. 28 days additional condition time is stayed and to be used at the agent's discretion.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Sandra C

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence in Counts 1, 2 & 3 and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

Conditions of Probation:
-  2 days condition time, court stayed commencement until 04/04/2015.  28 days additional condition time is stayed and to be used at the agents discretion.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- No contact with any area where drugs are packaged, consumed or sold.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $8,100 payable to BMO Harris.  FIRST PRIORITY.  The court further orders that all proceeds from the defendants divorce should be paid through the probation department to BMO Harris; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Stipulation
Sentencing Referral Form

As to Amended Counts 1, 2 and 3:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Warrant stayed on last court date is withdrawn.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information and waives formal reading.
Court ordered charge amended to:
Count 1 Theft by Fraud, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(d) and 943.20(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 2 Theft by Fraud, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(d) and 943.20(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 3 Theft by Fraud, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(d) and 943.20(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
*An amended information and a second amended information were filed.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case remains calendared for plea and sentencing on November 12, 2014 at 08:30am in Branch 22.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for preliminary hearing, however the defendant had a family emergency.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 22.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing, defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, Plea Hearing is adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for 09-12-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert who appears telephonicaly.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Joseph Schubert requests permission to appear telephonically in this matter on 06-06-2014 due to a conflict in calendar.  Permission given for telephone appearance for pretrial conference.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-06-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court with attorney Joseph E. Schubert.  Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-02-2014 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Joseph Schubert accepted the appointment of Counsel At County Expense by telephone after Indigency Hearing was concluded, and is aware of 03-18-2014 at 08:30am Status Conference Hearing.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Indigency Hearing proceeded.   Court reviewed documents provided by the State Public Defender.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Evaluation Form and statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation at the County's expense.   Defendant agrees to reimburse Milwaukee County for expenses of court appointed representation in this matter.  The court appointed Attorney Joseph Schubert to represent the defendant at a rate to be determined at next hearing;  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate to be determined upon establishing a payment plan.  Action in this matter adjourned for Status Conference at a later date in Branch 22.   Order Appointing Attorney At County Expense, SIGNED AND FILED.    Status conference scheduled for 03-18-2014 at 08:30 am.
FILE REMAINS IN COURTROOM FOR STATUS CONFERENCE.
Evaluation Form, FILED.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court.  Michael Lonski for Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.   Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sandra C. and the address of 2137 W. College Ave. #219, Oak Creek, WI.

Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Kurtis D Cesar in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
